Garage.

we got a punk band.
So here's what's crackin in episode one:

first we're gonna drop a blown small block

Water break dyno is a service
tool that applies a load
to an operating engine. It makes sure the engine has no deficiencies & is ready to run.
It's also a valuable tuning tool allowing us to extract maximum
performance from an operating engine.

Dyno operates in a controlled
environment

that we call an operating cell. Weather
conditions

inside the cell are constantly monitored
by a computer.

the computer establishes a standard
that we can use to compare this engine
with one being tested in New York or anywhere in between.

Beyond making sure the engine is ready to
run the Dyno is also useful

in trying out new parts and making tune up
purchases.
Once the dyno testing is complete, the engine's been given a clean bill of health
it's now ready to install in the vehicle.

comments.text:
I was one of two persons on a project to make a "SMV-tractor (slow car 
which you can drive 3 years before real cars)" diesel truck out of a Dodge 
b250 van. We shortened it (sounded easy until we figured the rear end is 
wider than the middle of the car). According to the rules of building one, 
you must convert it into a pickup model, so that you have only 10 cm behind 
the front seats. (No rear seats allowed.)
There was no engine in it, since that one was used for a v8 volvo 
conversion. So, we used a VW diesel i4 engine. To make it rear wheel drive 
we turned it 90 degrees, and welded the drive shaft to one of the former 
drive axles.
It was a lot of work, but turned out good. When I get old enough to drive a 
real car, I'm gonna try some projects with a bit more HP and speed 
involved.﻿

was told I didn't need the electronic shifter with mine. I'll have to see 
if I have the option, I got my trans from a local builder. Did you have to
